## Dir

**Extends Node**

Directory

**Parameters**

-   `name` **[string](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String)** 

### constructor

Constructor

**Parameters**

-   `name` **[string](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String)** 

### isDirectory

Returns true if it's a file system directory.

**Examples**

```javascript
const dir = new Dir('/');
dir.isDirectory(); // true
```

### isFile

Returns false if it's a file system directory.

**Examples**

```javascript
const dir = new Dir('/');
dir.isFile(); // false
```

## File

**Extends Node**

File

**Parameters**

-   `name` **[string](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String)** 
-   `body` **[string](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String)** 

### constructor

Constructor

**Parameters**

-   `name` **[string](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String)** 
-   `body` **[string](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String)** 

### getBody

Get file's body

### isDirectory

Returns false if it's a regular file.

**Examples**

```javascript
const file = new File('file.txt', '');
file.isDirectory(); // false
```

### isFile

Returns true if it's a regular file.

**Examples**

```javascript
const file = new File('file.txt', '');
file.isFile(); // true
```
